jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

220AADD587674542BB5BC4EBF7DC699F.description:
Explain how religious beliefs
shaped events in U.S. history.

9820077305A94CE8BE3BCCB70CF6491B.description:
Research information about the
environment during a specific
period of United States, and/or
world history using the World
Wide Web.

6321BCCACC09451E8F3A3AA9DB774845.description:
Explain how the location of the
major industrial regions fostered
their growth and development.

5C82EF93BC224044ADCB859F32D32B8E.description:
Identify on a map the major food
producing regions of the world .

77EEDF12F8F34B33B4E39A081FDEF6AF.description:
Identify the rivers that fostered
the growth and development of
U. S. and/or world.

FEC9740E1E834A3D9329F8A37665ABFB.description:
Describe how changes in
weather/climate affected the
physical and cultural features of
the environment.

49846B949F4C4EE2AB1EFC5B8F40B213.description:
Describe how hunter-gather
cultures used the environment to
secure their basic needs.

6A97939EC756448F88209B55F4C4D20C.description:
Explain how geography affects
the history, economics and
social life of people.

BAA4BEFF793843CCB34FB8ADFB22A957.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world environmental history (United States/World). Understand how Church belief regarding creation and God’s providence shape history of United States and the world. Demonstrate a general understanding of the “story” of humanity from creation to present through a Catholic concept of the world and man.
CSGS1
Relate how history begins and ends in God and how history has a religious dimension. CSIS1

52B434534429454686D05A62AFFB0906.description:
Compare/contrast the
customs and traditions of the
Catholic Church with other
religions.

2C41E2E4E04D49E484C3801524AE6030.description:
Compare/contrast the customs
and traditions of a past culture
with those of another past
culture.

E5A8838B899E40B5B5AF81C3A57829EF.description:
Compare traditions and
customs of a place or region
today with those from the
past.

853076652D7F41DEB91DAB1B2062F755.description:
Compare the life of people of
various social groups in the
past to people of the same
group during another time
period.

4765888AA5DD4EC692E2CBEA22F0F61D.description:
Identify the turning points in
United States, world and
Church social history.

6540174AA82349DF8CAADDD2A78A71A5.description:
Place a series of social events
on a timeline.

54ECAE1CA66440DD8B5A2C8261937B40.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world social history (United States/World). Understand social history of Church, Illinois, United States, and world. Demonstrate an understanding about great figures of history by examining their lives for examples of virtue. CSGS2
Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5

85F9AF89DAC14AB19F83AEB6FC47354D.description:
Compare/contrast past
economic activities to
contemporary economic
activities.

5512FABEC46743C2A11EA21C35BEB560.description:
Identify the differences
between an agricultural
society and a
hunting/gathering way of life.

CB78EDBAA9744660AF80EC132AADA94B.description:
. Tell how religious beliefs may
affect how people make a
living.

6504A561767848EDA0BB795ADEEBBBA3.description:
Tell how government affects
how people make a living.

3CEE021BE02344B08393D2E664F48A4C.description:
Understand the development of economic systems (United States/World). Understand how moral or religious thought contributed to the development of economic systems. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7
Discuss how history can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12

804EDFA36357490DAF42F2619AD8BBC9.description:
Recognize significant Church
or religious events that have
shaped the present day
Church.

EABFF029A6A144D2A230B6AAEBFFDE7B.description:
Describe a political system
and/or institution that existed
in the past.

F449661C22924C618165AFF619C326FF.description:
Recognize contributions of
important people and events
in the past, including
religious people/leaders.

CE8253DA23B047CB8BE147743D3F8ACC.description:
Place a series of political
events in their proper location
on a timeline of United States
and/or world history.

1E7CB008831A4D5F827C88C935A7C2FF.description:
Understand the development of significant political events (United States/World). Understand the development of significant Church or religious events. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4
Exhibit knowledge of essential dates, persons, places and facts, especially those relevant to the western traditions. CSIS

2A3763254FDD4CB0A875479A6F0BB3CF.description:
Locate a website for the study
of history, including Church
history on the World Wide
Web.

922D86D48DCD42489EAC66C5A6CCB643.description:
Describe aspects of life in a
specific period in a specific
region using a combination of
sources, include religious
beliefs.

8B899CA106FC43019FD4A3377BEDC47D.description:
Compare changes in a region
using an historical atlas.

B64D8DD5323740FCB4AF9C3140C0B5FB.description:
Describe historical trends
using data supplied on a
graph or chart.

16251812155F4C9DB16C2B40B7A75833.description:
Compare life in one region
during two different time
periods.

1895343D3DEE435AA9A17D40E0AB20B4.description:
Place a randomly ordered
series of events at the proper
points on a timeline, include
events in Church history.

54C710EF6D3D41AAB04F6796F73CD934.description:
Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation. Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation to religious events, trends and Church individuals and movements. Relate that Jesus, as God incarnate, existed in history just like we do. CSIS2
Describe how reading history is a way we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3

FF49FF2DE206405781D3718EAC0B33F3.description: Understand events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of Illinois, the United States and other Nations. Understand religious events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of the United States, other Nations and the Church.
